tutorial.title: Using AND
tutorial.descriptionContent: Using AND to filter by multiple conditions

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Sometimes we'll need to use more complex filters, like when looking for students majoring in Biology, who are also in their first year.

Click the buttons to see the results for each filter.

lessons.title: First condition
lessons.interactiveContent:
When filtering by multiple conditions, we start as usual by coding WHERE, followed by the first condition.

Make sure to pick WHERE, followed by major = 'Biology'.

lessons.title: Second condition
lessons.interactiveContent:
We then code the logical operator AND, followed by the second condition.

Make sure to pick AND, followed by year = 1.

lessons.title: AND logical operator
lessons.interactiveContent:
We use the logical operator AND to chain two or more conditions within a WHERE clause.

Make sure to type AND.

lessons.title: Both conditions
lessons.interactiveContent:
With AND, items have to satisfy both conditions. In our case, that means students items with major = 'Biology' and year = 1.

Make sure to pick = followed by 'Biology' and then AND, year = 1.

lessons.title: Question: First condition
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this query?

There should be a WHERE clause before the conditionsThere is nothing wrong with the query

There should be a WHERE clause before the conditions.

lessons.title: Question: AND logical operator
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we use AND to chain conditions?

We code AND between each two conditionsWe code AND followed by the conditions between parentheses ()

We code AND between each two conditions.

lessons.title: Question: Both conditions
lessons.interactiveContent:
Does this query select the item 1, Ford, 1955?

No, because it doesn't satisfy the second conditionYes, because it satisfies the first condition

No, because it doesn't satisfy the second condition.

lessons.title: Example: First condition
lessons.interactiveContent:
Select only cars manufactured by Ford, by coding WHERE and a condition.

Make sure to pick WHERE followed by manufacturer and then =, 'Ford'.

lessons.title: Example: Second condition
lessons.interactiveContent:
Select only cars manufactured by Ford in 1970, by adding AND followed by another condition.

Make sure to pick AND followed by year and then =, 1970.

lessons.title: Example: AND logical operator
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code AND followed by the second condition, year = 1970.

Make sure to type AND year = 1970.

lessons.title: As many as we want
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can chain as many conditions as we want. Code AND followed by year = 3 as a third condition.

Make sure to type AND year = 3.

lessons.title: Any kind
lessons.interactiveContent:
With AND we can chain any kind of conditions, like selecting students majoring in 'Biology' that are not in their first year.

Make sure to pick AND followed by year and then <>, 1.

lessons.title: Comparisons
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can also use AND with the <, >, <=, >= operators, like selecting items having a year >= 2 and year <= 4.

Make sure to pick >= followed by year and then <=, 4.

lessons.title: Comparisons  2
lessons.interactiveContent:
A condition like year >= 2 AND year <= 4 will give us items with a year between 2 and 4.

Make sure to pick >=, followed by <=.

lessons.title: Equivalent to BETWEEN
lessons.interactiveContent:
A condition like year >= 2 AND year <= 4 is equivalent to BETWEEN 2 AND 4.

Due to >= and <=, it selects values between 2 and 4 for the same column, year.

Make sure to pick BETWEEN followed by 2 and then AND, 4.

lessons.title: Question: As many as we want
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many conditions can we chain with AND?

As many as we wantAt most two

As many as we want.

lessons.title: Question: Any kind
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this query?

There's nothing wrong with the queryWe can't use comparisons with >= with AND

There's nothing wrong with the query.

lessons.title: Question: Comparisons  2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What kind of items does this query select?

Items with an ID less than 3, and a year greater than 2000Either items with an ID less than 3, or items with a year greater than 2000

Items with an ID less than 3, and a year greater than 2000.

lessons.title: Question: Equivalent to BETWEEN
lessons.interactiveContent:
What can we replace BETWEEN 1950 AND 1970 with?

year >= 1950 AND year <= 1970year > 1950 AND year < 1970

year >= 1950 AND year <= 1970.

lessons.title: Example: As many as we want
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a third condition with AND followed by ID < 3.

Make sure to type AND ID < 3.

lessons.title: Example: Any kind
lessons.interactiveContent:
To get items made before 1970 by a manufacturer other than Ford, code AND then manufacturer <> 'Ford'.

Make sure to type AND manufacturer <> 'Ford'.

lessons.title: Example: Comparisons
lessons.interactiveContent:
Select items with an ID of 2 or more, and a year greater than 1955.

Make sure to pick >= followed by 2 and then AND, year > 1955.

lessons.title: Example: Equivalent to BETWEEN
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use AND with the <= and >= operators to select items with a year between 1970 and 2000.

Make sure to pick WHERE followed by 1970 and then AND, year <=, 2000.

lessons.title: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can also use AND to chain conditions with BETWEEN, IN, and LIKE.

Make sure to pick AND.

lessons.title: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Here, we're selecting items where major = 'Biology' and year BETWEEN 2 AND 4.

Make sure to pick major = 'Biology', followed by BETWEEN 2 AND 4.

lessons.title: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
This gives us second-year through fourth-year students majoring in Biology.

Make sure to pick WHERE followed by = and then 'Biology', AND, year, BETWEEN, 2, AND, 4.

lessons.title: Question: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE
lessons.interactiveContent:
What kind of conditions can we chain with AND?

Any kind, including conditions with BETWEEN, LIKE, and INOnly conditions with comparisons like =, <, >

Any kind, including conditions with BETWEEN, LIKE, and IN.

lessons.title: Question: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What kind of items does this query select?

Items manufactured by either Ford or Jaguar between the years 1950 and 1960Items manufactured by Ford or items with a year between 1950 and 1960

Items manufactured by either Ford or Jaguar between the years 1950 and 1960.

lessons.title: Example: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code AND followed by a condition that checks if the manufacturer starts with the letter f.

Make sure to pick AND followed by manufacturer and then LIKE, 'f%'.

lessons.title: Example: IN, BETWEEN, and LIKE 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Link two conditions so that the query selects items with an ID between 2 and 4, and a year of either 1960 or 1970.

Make sure to pick BETWEEN 2 AND 4 followed by AND and then year, IN (1960, 1970).
